description: Change of use (part ground floor) from business (Use Class B1(a) to self-contained residential unit (Use Class C3), with associated refuse storage; installation and alteration to boundary wall; alteration to external elevations to ground floor
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):001 (existing and proposed ground floor plans and block plan); 002 (existing front, rear & side elevations); 003 (revised) (proposed front, rear and side elevations)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to occupation of the development, an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bedroom adjacent to staircase, living/dining room and kitchen above/below bedroom of separate dwellings shall be implemented and thereafter be permanently retained. . Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy D6 of the London Plan(2021); policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document.
| Prior to occupation of the flat the front boundary hedge shall be planted and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development hereby approved.

Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening and in the interests of providing a sustainable environment for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies D6 of the London Plan (2021); The London Environment Strategy (2018); and policies 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The residential units hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (20121.

| The existing crossover to the site shall be removed and restored to pavement prior to occupation of the development hereby approved. This shall be implemented by the Council at the applicant's expense.

Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, and in the interests of living conditions of adjoining occupiers and future occupiers of the development hereby permitted in accordance with London Plan policy 6.10, Development Strategy policies 1.1(g) and 1.2(f). | Prior to occupation of the flat ground floor flat, a timber screened refuse storage facilities to accommodate at least 2x120L bins for recycling and non- recycling as approved in Condition 2 shall be provided and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013)
| At least one (1) secure cycle parking space shall be provided on site and retained thereafter as shown in the approved plans under Condition 2.
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan(2021) policy T5 and table 10.2
